column1: This article shows a list of cities in Denmark by population. The population is measured by Statistics Denmark for urban areas (Danish: Byområder)
column2: defined as a contiguous built-up area with a maximum distance of 200 meters between houses
column3: unless further distance is caused by public areas
column5: to obtain the status of being a city (byområde)
column6: the area must have at least 200 inhabitants. Smaller settlements are by Danmarks Statistik included in numbers for rural areas (landdistrikter).
